Brave Face.name: Brave Face
Brave Face.description: Once per session, when an attack would cause you to mark a Stress, you can spend a Hope instead.

Close-Knit.name: Close-Knit
Close-Knit.description: Once per long rest, you can spend any number of Hope to give an ally the same number of Hope.

Duneborne.name: Duneborne
Duneborne.description: Being part of a duneborne community means you’ve made a home among the shifting sands and arid climate of the desert.

Found Family.name: Found Family
Found Family.description: Once per session, you can spend a Hope to use an ally’s community ability. When you do, your ally gains a Hope.

Freeborne.name: Freeborne
Freeborne.description: Being part of a freeborne community means you’re from a collective that lived under tyrannical rule and is now liberated.

Frostborne.name: Frostborne
Frostborne.description: Being a part of a frostborne community means you come from a place of snow and ice.

Hardy.name: Hardy
Hardy.description: Once per rest, you can Help an Ally traverse difficult terrain without spending a Hope.

Hearthborne.name: Hearthborne
Hearthborne.description: Coming from a hearthborne community means you come from humble origins, having lived in a small village or the countryside.

Oasis.name: Oasis
Oasis.description: During a short rest, you or an ally can reroll a die used for a downtime action.

Reborne.name: Reborne
Reborne.description:
You were once a member of another community, but you can no longer remember it.

At any point, when you’ve discovered the community you were once a part of, or have joined a new community, you can permanently trade this community card for that one instead.

Unbound.name: Unbound
Unbound.description: Once per session, when you make an action roll with Fear, you can change it to a roll with Hope instead.

Warborne.name: Warborne
Warborne.description: Being part of a warborne community means you come from a place that is, or was, ravaged by war.
